fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a single issue type is used, such as Epic, creating a child issue should display a warning message that only one issue type exist

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Issue type such as Epic in a Project
 # Create an Epic Issue
# Try creating a child issue inline to that epic

h3. Expected Results
A Warning message should display stating only one issue type exist in the project

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens


h3. Workaround

Ensure that multiple issue type exist in the project.
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Single Issuetype used in Project should display warning message on issue view

fields.description:
When you are selecting the recipient of the email message, it doesn't have the option to add a single user (search for the users) or project lead. 

Expected results: When searching, I was able to find the users or add project lead.

Actual results: When searching, I was not able to find single users or even the project lead option.
fields.summary: Automation notification for single users and project lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a site restore is performed, the issues restored shows the old data for a second in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project and add a few issues
 # In an issue add the summary *Test Summary*
 # Take a complete site backup in the backup manager
 # Now update the issue description to *Edited Test Summary* on the issue created in step 2
 # Now restore the backup on the same instance (overrides all the existing data)
 # Navigate to the issue created in step 2, the summary will be shown as *Edited Test Summary* for a second and then shows *Test Summary*

h3. Expected Results

The summary/description should be shown as per the issue summary in the backup
h3. Actual Results

Old data (Summary, Description) will be displayed for a moment
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: When a site restore is performed, issues shows the old data in the new issue view

fields.description:
As a project admin, it'd be beneficial to our team to have different project keys for the same project, based on the issue type.

For instance, using a project with key "PR" and three issetypes:

1. Bug
2. Support
3. Change Request

When a new issue is created, by default it takes the issue key for PR-1, PR-2 and so on for all issue types.

Instead, each "sub-issuekey" could have it's own counter, like so:

Bug - PB-1
Support - PS-1
Change Request - PC-1
fields.summary: Allow projects to have different project keys based on Issue Type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporting issues to CSV ( current fields) , for saved filters. If we have choosen certain columns in “Filters” section, its ignored and columns from ‘Default’ section gets exported 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a filter.
2. Click on columns -> Go to ‘Filter’ tab. Deselect certain columns , to keep as minimum no of columns as possible, say Assignee and Reporter. Click Done.
3. click on ‘Default’ tab , now click back on ‘Filter’ tab, earlier selected columns revert to one shown in default tab. ( not sure why this happens)
4. To workaround this , modify the filter to add few moe columns in the JQL , then save the edited filter. This time the columns in ‘Filter’ will not change to default.
5. Now , export the issues to CSV (current fields).


h3. Expected Results
It should consider the fields from the ‘Filter’ tab.

h3. Actual Results
It is exporting columns from Default tab


h3. Workaround
Currently , there is no workaround. Add/remove the columns in the 'Default' tab and then export the issues.
fields.summary: When exporting issues to CSV ( current fields) , for saved filters. If we have choosen certain columns in “Filters” section, its ignored and columns from ‘Default’ section gets exported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a filter query is exported to HTML, the formatting is lost in the HTML

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter text as colour in a Jira issue field (e.g. Description or custom field)
  !2020-06-05_15-26-20.png|thumbnail! 
 # Run a JQL to search for the issue e.g. {code}project = "Program Management" and issuekey="<issue key>"{code} and *Export HTML report (all fields)*

h3. Expected Results
* The field in the HTML output should be rendered in colour.

h3. Actual Results
* The field in the HTML output shows the formatting info as raw text
 !2020-06-05_15-27-02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a filter query is exported to HTML, the formatting is lost in the HTML

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Mail handlers, whenever a default Cloud mail server POP3 is chosen, in UI it still shows mapped to IMAP server. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
When trying to change the mail handler to default cloud server, it saves successfully.
When trying to edit the same again, the mail server still shows mapped to IMAP server.

 

h3. Expected Results

In UI it should show mapped to POP3

h3. Actual Results

Mapped to IMAP.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In Mail handlers, whenever a default Cloud mail server POP3 is chosen, in UI it still shows mapped to IMAP server.

fields.description:
When you're configuring a custom field through the screen below, it would be nice to have a button as "Cancel" or "Back" to avoid the necessity to use the browser's back button as well to avoid the user to click on the "X" button, which will delete the whole Scheme:

 !image-2020-06-04-19-10-34-367.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When configuring a custom field, it would be nice to have "Cancel" or "Back" button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using a HTTP image link on an issue causes the browser to render the page with a Not secure message on the Browser's URL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a priority name
 # Use an image that is publicly accessible with only HTTP
# Create an issue and set that issue with the priority you just created

h3. Expected Results
* Jira should enforce any Link to use HTTPS 

h3. Actual Results
* The Non HTTPS link causes the entire site page to be Not secure
*  !dev_tool.png|thumbnail! 
*  !url.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
 Make sure that any links used in the priorities uses HTTPS links.
fields.summary: Using none HTTP image link on a issue causes a Not Secure message on the URL

fields.description:
A Jira project can be linked to a Confluence space via the Pages feature. After the link is established there is no indication on the Pages UI to specify which space is currently linked. 

Workaround :
On Pages, create a Blank page to see which Confluence space will be launched.
fields.summary: Easily identify which space is attached to a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When doing a list operation on the approvers list of a Jira Service Desk issue, the result is not what the user configured. Example template code: h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a rule with Issue Create trigger # Try to retrieve below smart values in Add comment action {code}
    {{#issue.customfield_10027.approvers}}
  • {{approver.displayName}} - {{approverDecision}}
    • {{/}}
{code} h3. Expected Results Thomas - Approved Anna - Pending h3. Actual Results Thomas, Anna - Approved, Pending h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Iterating over approvers list via smart values does not produce the correct output

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting backslash in the comment of a ticket, the backslash renders correctly from the comment, but it renders as a newline in the email. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira issue on a testing project
 # In the comment insert "Hello\world"
 # The backslash rendered as a newline in the comment. 

h3. Expected Results
Backslash rendered correctly from the email. 
h3. Actual Results
Backslash rendered as a newline. 
The below format is shown from the email:
{noformat}
<br class="x_atl-forced-newline">
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Backslash renders as newline in the email.

fields.description:
As a user of Jira, I should be able to configure workflow triggers that are not just aligned to Jira fields.

 

Given that the user is using Bit bucket

When Bit bucket fields change

Then Jira workflow should update

 

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

- Ability to add deployment triggers for non Atlassian CI tooling
- Ability to create conditions and validations not just from Jira fields, but from Bitbucket fields as well (for example, don't move into tech review if PR title contains WIP, etc)
fields.summary: Improvement to workflow triggers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Global Administration, when clicking on a rule name and selecting "Open link in new tab" it shows the list of all rules instead. The same happens if you select "Open link in new window".

https://share.getcloudapp.com/geuwx56K

This also does not work if the “Copy link address” option in the right-button menu is selected. It rarely works and only if you wait for each rule to be loaded and only after this open another tab with another rule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Global administration section of Automation rules
# Click (right-button) on any rule
# Select "Open link in new tab" or "Open link in new window"

h3. Expected Results

The expected behavior was to open the Rule's details of the rule you've selected.

h3. Actual Results

The list of all rules is shown instead of the configuration section of the selected rule.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When clicking on a rule name and selecting "Open link in new tab" it opens the list of all rules instead

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to search for issues that have, for example, emojis in the text fields. Not even by typing :grin: in the Advanced Search, for example:

!SearchNoResults.png|thumbnail! 

!ExampleIssue.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Possibility to Search JIRA Issues Using Emojis As Search Criteria

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In old issue view, when we type a quote within comments \{quote} test \{quote} does not give an output as below : 

 | text
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In old issue view, go to comments field, type a quote \{quote} test \{quote}

h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-06-03-18-17-03-494.png|width=351,height=121!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-06-03-18-19-53-854.png|width=313,height=302!
h3. Workaround

To use new issue view
fields.summary: Quotes within comments does not work as expected - Old issue view

fields.description:
Currently when you create a new ticket from the slack integration it pops up something for you to confirm the data and click OK

It would be great if there was a way to not have to switch to a mouse, click stuff. Ideally, if everything was specified, it should just create the ticket.

However, if that's undesirable, then a separate keyword could be used:

/jira create task "some description here" commit

or something.
fields.summary: prompt-less ticket creation from slack

fields.description:
Currently the Slack integration supports:

 

/jira create task "some description here"

 

But it'd be nice to assign the ticket at the same time:

 

/jira create task for [john@sample.com|mailto:john@sample.com] "some description here"
fields.summary: The ability to add an assignee to ticket during creation with slack

fields.description:
In the Jira Cloud plugin for slack, it would be great if we could enable notifications *only* for tickets created via the slack bot. Currently when you associate a Slack channel to a Jira Project, you can choose to get *all* new tickets, or *no* new tickets. But what I'd like is to get tickets created from the bit. For example:

 

```

user1: Hey can someone do XYZ for me?
me: /jira create ticket do XYZ for user1

Jira ticket ABC-XXXX created: do XYZ for user1

```
fields.summary: [slack-jira] An option to channel notifications for *only* tickets created via slack.

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like to customize the image that is displayed when we select the Unassigned/Automatic option for user fields.

 

!abc.png!
fields.summary: Allow Jira administrators to customize the Unassigned/Automatic option icon.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Change the issue type triggers the update event, however changing it to Subtasks does not trigger it. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule with an update issue event as a trigger.
 # Change the issue type to subtasks.

h3. Expected Results
It should trigger the rule.
h3. Actual Results
It is not triggering the rule.
The problem might be related to the lack of a rest API endpoint to convert the issue type to subtasks. 
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Conversion into subtasks is not an trigger in Jira Automation

fields.description: There are now many things that can be renamed resulting in broken filters. The Atlassian policy seems to be not supporting any way to automatically fix the problems caused. One work-around that covers all cases to a degree would be an administrative edit operation which allows changing constant values in all filters in a project. This would at least let me rename a component or a version or a user and have a way to repair most of the havoc that causes. I don't think this is particularly difficult since you can already parse jql. You just want to attempt a string substitution on every "value". If you want to be more precise you could make the substitution field specific. Or, if even this is too onerous, at least give us an admin ability to search the filters and find the damaged ones.
fields.summary: Administrative mass modify of filter constants

fields.description:
h3. Summary

You can configure custom fields' contexts to specific projects and issue types.

When doing so, you can leave ti to be displayed on any issue type, or specific ones. 

Currently, you can select both options, which is redundant, and can cause confusion on user if they do not notice that the *Any issue type* options was still selected:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-02 at 14.14.32.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-06-02 at 14.14.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Prevent the selection of *Any issue type* when specific issue types are selected.
fields.summary: Prevent selection of "Any issue type" if specific issue types are selected within the field context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is great that the Jira automation feature is available, we would like to have a single Event Tigger with all Issues Operation including Comment/Transition/Create/Edit/Update/Delete etc, this will save us from having multiple rules.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Automation Rule
 # Select Multiple Issue Events
 
h3. Expected Results
 # The Event Comment Issues should be included in the Multiple Issue Trigger.

h3. Actual Results
# This event does not have Comment Issue

h3. Workaround
Create multiple rules.
fields.summary: Add issue commented to multiple events trigger

fields.description:
The audit log under "Security --> Audit log" would profit a lot from the option to exclude the "Logged in to account (un)successfully" and maybe "Logged out of account" with a check box or something similar.

Currently, the vast majority of log messages are those related to logging-in, drowning out more interesting log messages about other user and admin activity. Without the logging-in messages, there would be no need to tediously select all the other types in the dropdown menu in order to see all activity unrelated to logging-in.
fields.summary: Option to remove log-in lines from audit log

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Ability to Include comment into History, Worklog and other tabs in the new issue view

Old:

 !screenshot-1-old.png|thumbnail! 

New:

 !screenshot-2-new.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to Include comment into History, Worklog and other tabs in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you clone an issue with issue links in cloud, the JSON you get with the issue created event for this operation doesn't include any "issuelinks". That's because in Jira creating issues and establishing links isn't an atomic operation.  The links are created after the issue is created and then trigger their own issue link webhooks/events.

 

This is problematic for apps (like Automation for Jira), that want to do things like deleting all issue links after an issue has been cloned (or perhaps do something with the linked issues immediately after create). There's no way of knowing when an issue is really fully 'created' including all issuelinks etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with some issue links
 # Create an Automation rule in Automation for Jira like this:
 ## Trigger: Issue created
 ## Action: Delete issue links (all of them)
 # Then go ahead and clone that issue
 # Check the rule's audit log.  The rule runs but most of the time no issue links will be deleted.  It can be a bit arbitrary and timing related, but most of the time no issues links are deleted

h3. Expected Results

The issue JSON included in the issue created event on 'clone' should *always* include all issue links part of the clone.
h3. Actual Results

The issue JSON included with the issue created webhook doesn't include any issuelinks yet.
h3. Workaround
 * It's a bit of a shitty work-around, but the only thing one can do is to re-fetch the issue JSON after the issue:created event in the hope that all links have been established. But depending on the number of links being created or timing issues, that might still not be all issue links.
 * In Automation for Jira you can insert a 're-fetch issue data' action immediately after the trigger to do the above.  But as I mentioned it's not always a workaround.
fields.summary: When cloning an issue the issue webhook JSON doesn't include issue links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This appears to be a regression of JRACLOUD-21443 in which the filter results gadget will incorrectly display the order of issues if the saved JQL filter it is using happens to have 4 or more Order By clauses within it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JQL Saved filter such that it has at least 4 Order By clauses in it.  Example JQL queries where I have observed this:
#* {code:java}sprint is not empty and "Epic Link" is not empty ORDER BY Sprint ASC, status ASC, "Epic Link" ASC, key ASC {code}
#* {code:java} project = ssp ORDER BY priority, status, reporter, key ASC {code}
# On a Dashboard, add a new gadget of type Filter Results, select this saved filter from step 1

h3. Expected Results

We expect that the issue navigator in Jira and the gadget will display these issues in the same exact order
h3. Actual Results

It appears that the filter gadget does not honor that 4th order by clause, in this case key ascending.  The results in the gadget behave as if that 'key ASC' doesn't exist at all.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filter Results gadget does not honor the sorting criteria when there exist more than 3 Order By clauses

fields.description:
Jira offers the possibility to set none issue type as default. However, even after setting default issue type as "None", it still pre-select one issue type when the user creates an issue.

That's because the "None" option means that there is no default value, but not that "None" is going to be the pre-selected option. If "None" is set as default issue type, the system will actually show the first Issue Type listed in the Issue Types for Current Scheme.

It would be good to have the possibility to have "None" listed in the drop-down menu. This is to force users to select one issue type instead of accepting the one that is pre-selected.

!image-2020-06-01-16-38-24-927.png|width=231,height=183!

This was already raised as a bug through [*JRACLOUD-30620*|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30620], but the ticket was already closed.
fields.summary: Possibility to Set Default Issue Type as "None"

fields.description:
h3. Definition
As the header format is user@domain.com:apitoken and the API token format is controlled by Atlassian, consisting of alphanumeric characters, which will never include a space, LF, or other whitespace characters that are invisible to humans, there could be a validation to call trim() and remove/not consider such characters.

Sharing a bit of context, some users could use apps to store their passwords/API tokens and these apps could be adding such characters not allowed in the API token.

h3. Suggestion
Have a way of identify these characters and not consider them for authentication.
fields.summary: Add a header validation for API token part of authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA attachment preview doesn't show a digital signature in a PDF file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a PDF with a digital signature to an issue
 # Click on the PDF to open it in preview

h3. Expected Results
You see the pdf contents and the digital signature
h3. Actual Results
You see the PDF content without the digital signature
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Digital signature in PDF is not visible when previewed in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Normally, the issue collectors would return a feedback to the user after the form was submitted.

Currently, it is failing to render a message. Instead, the form just goes blank, and there is an error message in the browser console:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-01 at 13.22.53.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create an issue collector;
 * Copy its script, and paste in in a file like this one: [^test.html]
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-01 at 13.35.22.png|thumbnail!
 * Launch it in your browser (e.g. Chrome);
 * Try to submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is created, and there is a success message after the form submission.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is created, but the form just goes blank after the form submission.

The following error is displayed n the bowser console:
{code:java}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'attachment_error' of null
    at n (com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:form-collector.js?locale=en-US:3)
    at Object.success (com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:form-collector.js?locale=en-US:3)
    at Object.a.success (batch.js?locale=en-US:1419)
    at HTMLIFrameElement.g (batch.js?locale=en-US:1413)
{code}
h3. Workaround

Use different browsers(Firefox, Safari,etc) other than Chrome.
fields.summary: Issue collector visual bug after form submission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating a cascading field using the Edit issue > advanced, allows the child value to be "" (null), while it does not when you use _id_. In the issue history, it shows that the parent has been changed, but nothing about the child option. When you search for "Cascading field name" in cascadeOption("Option1", none), the issue is not returned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a cascading field and set a default value;
# Create an automation rule using the following params.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-29 at 15.20.19.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The parent value is changed to the corresponding value and the child is left empty, allowing the user to search for "Cascading field name" in cascadeOption("Option1", none).

h3. Actual Results
The issue history shows the parent value being updated, but not the child. So, when the user searches for "Cascading field name" in cascadeOption("Option1", none), the desired issue is not returned.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-29 at 15.21.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The Automation for Jira shouldn't allow users to leave the child value empty, as it doesn't while using _id_ instead of value.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-29 at 15.26.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira let the user leave the child value for cascading fields empty
When perming a bulk operation the "Send mail for this update" come checked by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/bug-its-no-longer-possible-to-get-current-user-in-jira-mobile-app/38737], in Android and iOS, all of methods available on AP.user (getCurrentUser, getTimeZone, getLocale) no longer invoke the callback given as an argument.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run an app on iOS or Android that has a glance and calls `AP.user.getCurrentUser(userData => \{console.log(`The user data is ${JSON.stringify(userData)}`)})`.

h3. Expected Results

The log statement is called.
h3. Actual Results

The log statement is NOT called.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: AP.user module unavailable in Android and iOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the project rule aborted to the project settings, the single project rule shows a global rule.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single project rule
 # Try to create a scenario where we have exceeded the global execution rules based on license. 
# the single project rule will be aborted and it shows as Global rule. 

h3. Expected Results
The single project will remain as a single rule.

h3. Actual Results
Single project rule shows as Global.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project rule shows as global in the audit log if aborted

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update from Atlassian - 1 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all, 

My name is Venkatesh and I’m a product manager on the Jira cloud team. Thank you for leaving feedback on this ticket. Given the level of interest in this ticket we’ve researched and assessed supporting more than 120 attachments in the new issue view.

*Decision*

Based off our research, *we won’t be supporting more than 120 attachments for now*

*Reasoning*

We assessed different use-cases for having more than 120 attachments and decided to keep this limit because
 * Having more than 120 attachments contributes to slower performance, larger amount of bugs and decreases the usability of Jira. Our team’s focus is primarily on making Jira easier and efficient to use, and supporting this feature detracts from this goal.

 * Upgrading our service to support more than 120 attachments poses a security risk for our customers. At Atlassian, security is one of our companies highest priorities for our customers and we wouldn’t want to jeopardise our customers' security.

*Next Steps*

I am going to convert this to a feature request so that we can continue to gather feedback. I know this won’t be the decision a number of you are looking for, and I’m sorry for that. We believe this is the best decision for most users, with the information we have right now.

If you would like to connect to talk about why you require more than 120 attachments, please feel free to email me at [vvasudevan@atlassian.com|mailto:vvasudevan@atlassian.com] so we can discuss your use-case in more detail.

We’re always looking to reassess and improve our experiences. If new information comes to light that suggests we should iterate this approach, we’ll definitely reconsider. Please remember that [jira.atlassian.com|http://jira.atlassian.com/] is one of many inputs for the Jira roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Thanks again for your feedback.

Venkatesh, 
Product Manager,
Jira Cloud




*Old Update*
This issue was formerly tracked by: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72355

As part of tracking the previous ticket we rolled out an improvement that doubled the number of attachments an issue could hold prior to failing from 60 to 120. This ticket represents the continuation of this work and the seperate issue of handling more than 120 attachments on an issue.
{panel}
h3. Summary

If you attach a large number of attachments on an issue the new issue view fails to load them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach more than 150 attachments on an issue.
 # Try to view the attachments on issue view.

h3. Expected Results

Attachments load and the thumbnails of attachments are visible on the issue view.
h3. Actual Results

Attachments show "Failed to load" error. 
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: New issue view fails to load attachments when there are more than 120 attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Read the Jira entity properties documentation, [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/jira-entity-properties]

h3. Expected Results

The documentation specifies either the maximum number of entity properties that can be stored or that it is unlimited.
h3. Actual Results

The documentation does not specify any semantics relating to the maximum number of entity properties that can be stored. 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Document the maximum number of Jira entity properties allowed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not possible to sort by Cascading field after you update its value

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a cascading field 
# Add a parent with two child
# Create a new parent and other two child
# Set the field value on a ticket
# Update its value
# Create a JQL that orders by the field created on step 1


h3. Expected Results
Your search should be ordered based on the field value

h3. Actual Results
On UI the following error is returned:
{noformat}
An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Contact support.
fields.summary: Not possible to sort by Cascading field after you update its value

fields.description:
(!) This issue is intermittent

h3. Issue Summary
Whenever a comment is sent with an attachment on it, the image is now shown in the email and shows a broken link. Once you click on the image, the attachment is downloaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and post a comment with an image attached;
# Wait for the notification.

h3. Expected Results
The images are shown in the email notification.

h3. Actual Results
The images are shown broken, but when you click on it, it is downloadable.

h3. Workaround
* Look for the attachment directly in the issue view.
* Change the *Email from* in the general configurations (https://<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa) to anything different than *${fullname} (Jira)*.
fields.summary: Images on attachments are showing broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/jira/your-work if you Atlassian Account is configured to use a language such as Italian, Japanese, French the shortcut for the queues on JSD projects will not load. 

This presents slightly differently depending on if you have just Jira Service Desk or both Service Desk and Software.

If you have just JSD you will see an error message:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 09.48.05.png|thumbnail! 

If you have multiple products the queue shortcut will just not load without an error:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 09.48.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD Site
 # Create a project
 # Change you account language in admin.atlassian.com to Italian for example
 # Access the *Your Work* page

h3. Expected Results
The page should load as expected and load all shortcuts to the JSD queues:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 09.51.05.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The page loads but the shortcuts either fail to load at all or show an error message depending on the products your site has. 

* If your site has only Jira Service Desk:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 09.48.11.png|thumbnail! 

* If your site has Jira Service Desk and Software:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 09.48.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Queue shortcuts for JSD projects fail to load in "Your Work" page when you account is set to some languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachments containing special characters in the title will not render
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a file with special characters in the title

h3. Expected Results
The file should render in fields or attachments section correctly
h3. Actual Results
The attachment will not be available and show " Unable to render embedded object: File not found. " 

h3. Workaround
Remove all special characters from the attachment file
fields.summary: Attachments containing special characters in the title will not render

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to create a Jira issue from a Trello card, but not the other way around.

It would be great to have an option in the issue view to manually create a card in Trello.
fields.summary: Ability to create Trello card from Jira issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Crash log reference EXC_BAD_ACCESS: NSTextInputContext_RemoteTextInput_UIKitOnMac

h3. Steps to Reproduce
There are no definitive steps to reproduce.

h3. Expected Results
No crash will occur.

h3. Actual Results
The app crashes. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: While entering the description when creating an issue on Jira for Mac may result in an unexpected crash

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to create a ticket from mobile 

h3. Environment
* This can be reproduced on Jira Android version 49.0.414  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download Jira from an Android phone and make sure it's version 49.0.414.
# Create a ticket from the phone
# An error occur. 

h3. Expected Results
The ticket gets created.

h3. Actual Results
"Can't create the issue in this project. Try a different project." error is returned.
fields.summary: Jira Mobile-Can't create ticket

fields.description:
At the moment, there is no direct way to import excel files and have to be converted to CSV to import to Jira.

Provide the ability to import issues from excel files using a built-in Excel file import option similar to CSV import.
fields.summary: Ability to support built-in Jira importer for Microsoft Excel files

fields.description:
Summary:
 * There isn't any indication/logs on who performed the changes to ProjectEmail in the project settings. Eg:
 ** /plugins/servlet/project-config/<project_key>/notifications 
 **  !image-2020-05-28-16-49-49-876.png|thumbnail! 

Suggestion:
 * To include the event in the Audit log and identify which user performed the changes
fields.summary: Ability to identify which user changed the ProjectEmail

fields.description:
Votes are a special field that are not included in the "Field value changed" trigger. For users that want to take some action after a vote is cast on a Jira issue, they currently have no options with Automation.

Adding "issue voted on" as a trigger event would allow rules to action when new votes are added.
fields.summary: Add issue vote as automation trigger

fields.description:
I've configured a post function to copy the value from the parent in subtask workflow, this post function is working. The value is being copied for the subtask, however, it is not automatically selected in create issue screen. 

*Expected results*: In create an issue screen, the field values must be automatically selected since I've created a post function to copy the value from the parent.

*Actual results*: In create an issue screen, the field is not automatically selected. However, the main function of copy the field value is working after clicking in the create button.

Also, follow below an image of my workflow configuration

  !Screen Shot 2020-05-27 at 10.16.24.png|width=267,height=67!
fields.summary: Copy a value from the parent doesn't automatically select the value when creating a child issue

fields.description:
for a Next-gen project if I perform an advanced search by sprint only parents are returned. no sub-tasks are displayed.

example....

 

!image-2020-05-27-08-30-58-501.png|width=440,height=381!
fields.summary: As a user of Next-gen I would like sub-tasks to be displayed in my JQL sprint query

fields.description:
It would be helpful to include the ability to share Reports/Charts to users who don't necessarily have permission to access the project data directly.

This would allow for those external users to access the top-level statistics provided by the reports, without risking their ability to access the specific PII on a per-issue basis.
fields.summary: Allow for External or Public access to Reports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* This issue only affects users who have been removed and then re-added to a Cloud site
* When a user is removed from a Cloud site, their username is obfuscated e.g "user1" becomes "removed10"
* When a user is re-added to the site, the obfuscated username is not updated
* This causes issues when trying to add that user to a group using the [REST API as described here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-group-user-post]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove and re-add a user in the Cloud site
 # Try to add a user using the REST API as described here: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-group-user-post

h3. Expected Results
* The user is added to the specified group

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
{
    "errorMessages": [
        "An error occurred: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.UserNotFoundException: {\"schemas\":[\"urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error\"],\"status\":\"404\",\"detail\":\"A user with removed10 doesn't exists\",\"errorType\":\"UserDoesNotExist\",\"message\":\"A user with removed10 doesn't exists\",\"data\":\"removed10\"}"
    ],
    "errors": {}
}
{noformat}
* There is a 404 response saying that the user "removed10" doesn't exist, when the user has been re-added to the site and has an active account.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to add a user to a group via REST API - unexpected 404 response

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an email is considered as "response-status", Jira rejects this email as if it's "email loop". This is an edge case where Jira should have processed it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email to [jira@<url>.atlassian.net|mailto:jira@url.atlassian.net] with email that is classified as "response-status"

h3. Expected Results

Jira processes this email and convert it to either comment/new issue.
h3. Actual Results

Jira rejects this email
h3. Workaround

Update the email/forwarding rules to avoid emails being classified as "response-status".
fields.summary: Email classified as response-status is not proceed by Jira mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an automation rule to create a sub-task when issue type is "Story" or "Bug" gives a message as highlighted below :

!image-2020-05-26-12-29-25-474.png|width=271,height=125!
{noformat}
No sub-task issue type defined in this project. 
In order to use this action you need to add some sub-task issue type first. {noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a rule on project B
 ** *Trigger :* When issue created
 ** *Condition :* If the issue type is Story/Bug
 ** *Action :* Create a subtask and update field labels. 

(flag) Note : The sub-task issue type already exists in the project b. 

The same steps works on project the A.
h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-05-26-12-29-50-804.png|width=562,height=247!
h3. Actual Results

Unable to create an action to create sub-task.                                                                              !image-2020-05-26-12-30-10-723.png|width=271,height=125!
h3. Workaround
 * you can use the rule in project "A" , by copying it and using in project B.

[or]
 * You can add multiple project in the same rule by going Jira settings -> System -> Automation Rules -> All Rules -> Choose the rule -> click on scope (Multiple projects) -> project (b) along with project A
fields.summary: Automating to create sub-task does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

To provide administrators with a better user experience, the page hosting an app's post install page should also link to the app's admin pages (if provided).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app that provides a post install (get started) page and one or more admin pages.
 # Click on the "Get started" button.

h3. Expected Results

The page that displays the app's post install (get started) page provides links to the app's admin pages.
h3. Actual Results

The page that displays the app's post install (get started) page DOESN'T provide links to the app's admin pages. This makes it difficult for the user to understand how to manage and configure the app.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Installing apps with post install and admin pages results in significant friction

fields.description:
Currently, this is available for Android OS but on IOS the custom fields are not rendering, they will show as it follows:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Availability to render tables from custom fields to Jira Cloud IOS

fields.description:
Personally I would like to 3-strike then ban users for leaving comments like "+1 pretty pls" instead of upvoting the ticket. 

But, apart from some valid suggestions left by another user in the Jira Server project, to alert users before they can leave such garbage comments about the option of voting for the issue instead, the best solution to tackle the needless email spam would be to give all users the option to opt out of receiving notifications for comments that either contain nothing of value at all (+1) or that start with +1 and have very likely little to add.
fields.summary: Ability to opt out of email notifications for comments starting with "+1"

fields.description:
`h3. Issue Summary

Not possible to import rules through JSON files, even though the rule the user is trying to import was just exported from the same Cloud instance.

The JSON does not have any issues since nothing was found in the JSON validator.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export any rule;
 # Try to Import the rule using the file of the just exported rule:

!image-2020-05-25-17-51-05-020.png|width=217,height=117!
h3. Expected Results

The rule should be imported fine, with no errors. If, for example, the rule refers to a field that does not exist in the current instance, the user should be able to fix it later.
h3. Actual Results

The following error is shown in the UI:

!image-2020-05-25-17-59-18-857.png|width=264,height=245!

The request shows a 400 error:

!image-2020-05-25-17-54-30-182.png|width=533,height=247!

The logs show a WARN, with a {color:#ff0000}_Falling back to static ssr url_{color} message.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not possible to import Automation rules - Error parsing provided JSON error message is being shown

fields.description:
Our application displays information for a list of users, including several of the custom properties configured by the app for them - for each of these users.

It would be great if we could load this information in batches and retrieve only required data. Jira Expression could have been just the 'tool' to use ... just that it does not allow loading users. Right now the app needs to do a tone of requests to retrieve all this data.

Do you think you could add a users context variable where we can specify a list of account ids?
fields.summary: Please add support for loading users in Jira Expressions

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability to set other users' information at the drop down from fields like Request participant, Watchers, Reporter, Assignee. Such as:

 !Jobtitle.png|thumbnail! 

 This would be helpful to help identify a user that would need to be a watcher or requested on the ticket. An example is when we look at watchers and request participants we automatically see everyone's name. Other information that helps us know if we have the correct user is their job title. In customers' scenarios sometimes there are multiple people with the same first and last names. Seeing their job title will be helpful to identify if the selected person is the correct one or not.
fields.summary: Ability to add more users' information at the search of the fields

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to view the project roles that the user belongs to in Next-Gen projects under the "_*View project roles for User*_" page. 
 Currently, the functionality is supported by Jira Classic Projects only.
h3. *Current functionality with classic projects:*

1) Navigate to User management window in _admin.atlassian.com_:

_Jira Settings > User management_

2) In the User Management window, select "_Users_" and click on the desired user to view the details.

3) In the User details page, click "*...*" and select "_View Jira project roles_"

!Screenshot 2020-05-25 at 7.42.38 PM.png|width=229,height=310!

4) In the "*View Project Roles for User*" page, we see a list of Jira classic projects along with the project roles to which the user belongs to. This page is useful to check the access of the user to each project. 

However, Next-Gen projects are not included in this list and hence we do not have an option to view the project roles that the user belongs to in Next-Gen Projects.

In Next-Gen projects, each project needs to be individually checked in order to confirm the project role that the user belongs to.

*Requested Functionality:*
 It would be great if Next-Gen project roles could also be included under "_*View Project Roles for Users*_". This would make it easier to check the access of the users to the Next-Gen projects as well.
fields.summary: Ability to view project roles for Next-Gen projects in order to check the access to the projects for each user

fields.description:
Currently, there's no way to list all fields set as 'required' in a Field Configuration. The only way to find these fields is by going through each page of the Field Configuration and using the browser's 'find' feature (ctrl/cmd+F) searching for the word "Required". The problem with that solution is when there are a lot of pages you have to go through in order to verify all fields.
h3. Suggestion
 # Implement the possibility to list all required fields more easily.
 # Remove the pagination of Field Configurations so it's possible to search for all required fields on the same page.
 # Create the ability to reorder fields based on whether they're required or optional.
fields.summary: Ability to list required fields in a Field Configuration

fields.description: We want to remove the site access for the users to reduce license consumption. We can see an option to remove the access for the user one at a time but there is no option to select multiple users from the interface. Every month we need to remove site access for multiple users so can we have this feature added?
fields.summary: Bulk removal of site access for Multiple users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The top part of the issue view is missing if viewing the issue from Filter List View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Toggle to the New Navigation
 # Open a Filter
 # Change from *Detail View* to *List View*
 # Click on an issue to open issue view

h3. Expected Results

To be able to see the Project name, Filter name, Issue link, See the old view and ... for more Actions.

 !Expected result.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results

The top part of the issue details is not visible.
 !Actual result.png|thumbnail! 


In old navigation sometimes the text is cropped or missing completely.
 !Old navigation - Filter- List View.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

 View issue from Filter *Detail View*
fields.summary: The top part of the issue view is missing if viewing the issue from Filter List View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary: The Bell Notification once clicked, doesn't show the new event counts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the UI, the bell icon initially shows how many new events occurred.


 # Once click the bell icon, the count will disappear.



h3. Expected Results If the user doesn't read all the new events, then the count should still be appearing. This will give an indication to the user that there are still unread events to go through.
h3. Actual Results Once clicked the Bell notification, the count disappears.

h3. Workaround

Once bell notification is clicked, all the unread messages will be displayed with a blue dot, which will help the user to distinguish between read and unread events.
fields.summary: Bell Notification once clicked, doesn't show the new event counts

fields.description: Our Jira team board has 400+ issues in a backlog column, which causes the browser to slow to a crawl. It would be great if I could collapse a column and then have it not render in the DOM. This is different than a filter since it'd be technically filtering out an entire column?
fields.summary: Allow collapsing of columns

fields.description:
Availability to change the length for URL Custom Field

Currently, it will only show the first 50 characters and then just show 3 dots at the end
fields.summary: Availability to change the length for URL Custom Field

fields.description: WOuld be great if it was possible to extend the contains operator (~) to be used with Issue keys in JQL queries.
fields.summary: Extend the contains operator (~) to be used with Issue keys in JQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Application Links are being overwritten when editing one of them. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* create two generic application links (don’t have to point to actual systems)
* go to /plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks to configure them
* enter the details on the Incoming Authentication settings page and save it
* do the same with the other applink and the settings will be the same

h3. Expected Results
Only the app link that is being edited/created will have its settings modified.

h3. Actual Results
All the other app link will inherit the same Incoming Authentication settings.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Different (generic) application links overwrite each others incoming consumer settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In its current state, the *Send email* action is limited to having a default sender which is noreply@automationforjira.com and this cannot be modified or hidden.

h3. Proposed solution

When expanding the _More options_, the *From* email address should be configurable on the automation rule just like how the *From name* is already configurable.
fields.summary: Ability to change the FROM email address.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue security filter no longer works for Slack integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Integrate Slack channel to a JIRA project.
# Set issue security level for the Slack integration filter.
!image-2020-05-22-18-46-50-866.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a JIRA issue.


h3. Expected Results

Only JIRA issues with the specific issue security level should be returned in the Slack channel.

h3. Actual Results

All JIRA issues regardless of issue security level is returned in the Slack channel. Basically the issue security filter is broken. It doesn't work at all.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. Due to JQL not supporting issue security field (as highlighted in JRACLOUD-70184) , it is not possible to use the issue security field in the JQL condition.
fields.summary: Issue security filter no longer works for Slack integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there isn't a way to log work while changing assignee based on statues. The reason is that log work is being controlled by project-level permission, once the log work permission is granted, a user can do log work anytime on any status. And there isn't a built-in feature to log work based on certain statues.
h3. Suggested Solution

The ability to log work based on statues while changing assignee/
h3. Why this is important

Keep track of the log time based on statues.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Ablity to log work based on statues while changing assignee

fields.description:
In Jira, there is a new feature which allows end users to request for apps to site admins. However , for some customers it may not be ideal to allow end users to request. 

Please give the option to Site-admins to disable these app requests.

_Note:The option stated in the document to disable is currently not available._
 _[https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/managing-user-requests-for-marketplace-apps-781394968.html_]_
fields.summary: Ability to disable app requests for site-admins

fields.description:
My team-managed (formerly next-gen) project has a 'Version' filter on the Backlog view but the active sprint board doesn't have that filter. When we trying to understand in the current sprint what stories/bugs are for the upcoming release vs. those stories for a later release this filter is very important.

We had the filter in the old projects and used it religiously.
fields.summary: Add a Version filter to the Active Board for team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description:
The backlog and issue view page should automatically refresh when you make a change in an issue.

Use case: The customer creates a custom field that inserts values in the story points field, checking the backlog the story points is configured to be shown. With this information, when the user open the backlog and click in an issue, the issue will be shown on the right side of the backlog. If you change the value of the custom field, the story point (viewing from the issue view and backlog) is not updating automatically, for the field to be updated, in both views, it is necessary to click on the reload the web page. After doing this the values are showing correctly.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a custom field single choice list.
 # Create an automation role that inserts the values from the custom field created in the story points field.
 # Enable the story points to be shown in the backlog view. 
 # Update the value from the field that you have created.

Expected results: After inserting the value in that field, the backlog and the issue view updated automatically without pressing the refresh button of the web page.

Actual results: After inserting the value in that field, the backlog and the issue view is not updating and I have to press the refresh button of the page to update those values.

Workaround: update the webpage.
fields.summary: Automatic refresh on backlog and issue view after an issue update

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, when adding a value, for example, on a dropdown or checkbox custom field, it's not possible to click on the value to open the JQL and view all issues that contain that value.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the same option as Labels or Components, where it's possible to click and be redirected to "Search issues".
fields.summary: Add hyperlink for custom fields

fields.description:
Issue - *Advanced search=> Detail* view is not showing up total count of issues on top right in new issue view whereas it used to show the count earlier. Now also in the old issue view, it loads fine and shows the correct count.

*Steps to replicate* -
 * In the new issue view, click on Advanced search for issues and monitor the top right part of where we see watcher icon, the total count will load for a second and then disappear.
 * Replicate the same behavior in an old issue view and you will be able to see the count.
 * This happens only when we select a detail view from the Detail/List option for the display.
 * Screenshots below :
fields.summary: Advanced search=> Detail view is not showing up total count of issues on top right in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*1 - On the new navigation*

When accessing an issue from a filter in the list view the top part doesn't appear (project, Issue Type, Watchers, Share, and Additional Actions buttons). This issue is only happening in the *new issue view*.
 !image-2020-05-19-10-35-48-515.png|thumbnail!

*2 - On the old navigation (with sidebar instead of top-bar)*

The top portion gets cut:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-21 at 10.39.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a filter in list view;
 # Click on an issue;
 Follow below a video with the steps:
 [^Screen Recording 2020-05-18 at 04.28 PM.mov]

h3. Expected Results

The top portion of the issue will be rendered correctly.


h3. Actual Results

The top portion of the issue is not rendered correctly.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround is to open the issue in a new tab *OR* erase the filter from URL: https://<your instance>.atlassian.net/browse/GEN-91-?filter=10105-
fields.summary: When accessing an issue from a filter in the list view its header is not rendered correctly

fields.description: In JSD, the customer wants to have a better-customized experience when a user has access to a single project. If the user has only one project, there isn't a customized logo present. For a better Customer experience, the logo should be present even if only a single project is assigned to the user. The following pictures will provide a good representation of the reported absence of the logo. In one screen the user has two projects and then the user can see the logos and select which project he should select. When the user has only one project there is no logo present.
fields.summary: User don't see project logo if he has only one project. By design, it only shows the logos when user has more than one project.

fields.description:
It would be great to have Jira Cloud available via a pwa as they are much lighter weight than native apps.

Example: Twitter.com, where there's a "+" icon in the address bar.
fields.summary: PWA for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the general configuration section, you can disable the option to allow users to share filters with the public:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 15.09.56.png|thumbnail! 

But, when doing so, the current sharing applied, that is, the public sharing is still active on all the filters. 

That causes a problem: when you try to edit a public shared filter, it won't allow you to save any changes on that filter due to the current "policy".

h3. Suggestion

Change the current sharing of the filters when disabling the ability to share filters with the public, or give the options to select the new kind of sharing you desire for those filters.
fields.summary: Change current sharing configuration of filters when disabling public share setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding default members to Project role , by typing the group name , instead of using the user picker , can have adverse effect on 'Browse project' permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project role called Basic Access.
 # Create a group called 'users' ( small letter 'u')
# Add default members to this role, by typing 'Users' , instead of using the user picker. ( refer screenshot ).
 !Screenshot 2020-05-20 at 11.15.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# UI shows the default members as 'Users', however the default group here is 'users'
 !Screenshot 2020-05-20 at 11.16.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Grant Browse project permission to this role 'Basic Access', this group is not displayed in People section of project , however default members of this group can still access the Project.
 !Screenshot 2020-05-20 at 11.17.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-05-20 at 11.17.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
People section of project should display this group 'users' along with the role 'Basic access'
h3. Actual Results
No users are displayed in People section.

h3. Workaround
Remove the default group from this role and the group back again from the user picker.
fields.summary: Adding default members to project role by typing the group name instead of selecting from user picker can break project permission.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
An issue is transitioned from one status to another yet the status of the issue is not changed in the issue history.

In the case of the transition being to a final state with no outgoing transition, no traction options are then available to correct this.

The {{os_workflow}} and {{os_currentstep}} tables are updated correctly only the issue status in the {{jiraissue}} table is not updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
_N/A: Not reliably replicable due to difficulty in meeting race conditions_ 

h3. Expected Results
The status of the issue should be updated on transition.

h3. Actual Results
The status of the issue is not updated, but the transition can be seen in the issue history. 

h3. Workaround
It is possible to use a CSV import to update to correct the status, alternatively please contact Atlassian support who can manually correct this status value for you.
fields.summary: Race condition causing the status value to not be updated on transition despite being shown in the issue history.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to load code review option from dev panel in New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Configure the code review for Jira issue. 
Access the code review in new issue view from Jira and it doesn’t respond. 
When opened this in a new tab, the issue automatically opens up in the old issue view and in old issue view the code review is accessible. 


h3. Expected Results
After clicking on the review option under development panel, the review screen should pop up. 

h3. Actual Results
The code review does not work in new issue view. 

h3. Workaround

Open the code review in a new tab and it will open it up in old issue view or directly use old issue view to view the code review.
fields.summary: Unable to load code review option from dev panel in New issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the deactivated user had commented on the issue, that deactivated user is still listed in @mention.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an active user, add comment on an issue
# Deactivate that user;
# Go back to that issue as another user, add a comment and use @mention to see the list of users

h3. Expected Results
Deactivated user is not shown in the @mention list.

h3. Actual Results
Deactivated user is still showing in the @mention list.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 07.51.27.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 07.53.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: If deactivated user had commented on the issue, that deactivated user is still listed in @mention

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update }
Hi everyone,

As part of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70129, we released an attachments list view to the new issue view in Jira. The list view enables you to see a summary of all attachments on the issue and can be sorted by date, size or name of the file. 

Kind regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
 

Currently we have an attachment summary in the old issue view and can be arranged in a chronological order. (Images attached from the old issue view)

However this feature is missing in the new issue view. 
 Would be great to see if this can be implemented in new issue view as well.
 Currently it consumes time to scroll through all the comments to check for one attachment, if the ticket includes 20+ comments.
fields.summary: New issue view should have an attachment summary.

fields.description:
With recent change due to GDPR, we are no longer able to search a removed user with a display name. 

It is not convenient for the administrator to search removed user's account ID and then search removed user-related data.

For Example:

If we have to change the ownership of the removed user, we no longer able to search the user with a display name in Global Issue Navigator and in JQL as well.
fields.summary: Searching removed user with display name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While running below API, it returns different results. 
For Example:

https://<cloud_url>/rest/api/3/users/search?maxResults=32&startAt=0
- with maxResults = 32 => 24 active users
- with maxResults = 42 => 25 active users
- with maxResults = 50 => 25 active users
- with maxResults = 100 => 31 active users
- with maxResults = 1000 => 31 active users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Execute below API with different Maxresults:
https://<cloud_url>/rest/api/3/users/search?maxResults=32&startAt=0
https://<cloud_url>/rest/api/3/users/search?maxResults=50&startAt=0
https://<cloud_url>/rest/api/3/users/search?maxResults=1000&startAt=0

h3. Expected Results
- with maxResults = 32 => 31 active users
- with maxResults = 42 => 31 active users
- with maxResults = 50 => 31 active users
- with maxResults = 100 => 31 active users
- with maxResults = 1000 => 31 active users

h3. Actual Results

- with maxResults = 32 => 24 active users
- with maxResults = 42 => 25 active users
- with maxResults = 50 => 25 active users
- with maxResults = 100 => 31 active users
- with maxResults = 1000 => 31 active users

h3. Workaround

Please use maxResults value to 1000.
fields.summary: Inconsistent API response with different Maxresult Values

fields.description:
I'd like the ability to link an issue by simply pasting in the URL for a Jira ticket into the 'linked issues' field.

Right now I need to cut the ticket number out from the URL, and then paste the ticket number into the field. I would prefer to be able to simply paste the ticket URL into the field and have Jira recognize it. This would trim a few clicks off the current process.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/95540iCFC882A02AB5D984/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Note that with the new Jira interface, I don't dare click into the window itself to try and copy and paste text anymore since clicking ANYWHERE can switch it into 'edit' mode and so it seems a safer bet to simply copy the URL, when I don't wish to edit anything in the original ticket.
fields.summary: Allow adding 'linked issues' by URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Next-gen project is created with the same issue type ( eg Epic, Task, etc ) as the existing classic projects, we are unable to query the custom field value in the Basic search
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Classic project
 2. Create a Next-gen project
 3. Go to Administration > Issues > Custom fields
 4. Navigate to that Custom field, then go to Cog Icon > Configure

 !Screenshot 2020-05-20 at 1.17.55 AM.png|thumbnail! 

5. Edit the *Applicable contexts* for the scheme with any *issue type* present in the next-gen project. ( So if you refer above-attached screenshot, I have added Task in the field scope, Task is used by both Classic and Next-gen project)

6. Try searching for issues using that Custom Field on Basic Search
h3. Expected Results

You are able to select the Field on the Basic Search.
h3. Actual Results

A warning is shown on the UI: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type" and so not able to list the options for the custom field. Please refer to the 2nd screenshot attached.

h3. Workaround

Use the Advanced search and JQL should still work. ( referring to the first screenshot)
fields.summary: Fields Values cannot be queried via Basic search in Jira when issue type context is applied

fields.description:
The ticket submission fields are inadequate and could greatly benefit from a participants field so that team members who are affected will be notified of the ticket's creation and subscribed to that ticket's changes. 

 

Consider this: 

A department lead makes a ticket for a failmode machine. They have no ability to subscribe participants to the ticket. This means their supervisor, affected department leads in other areas, and maintenance leads are then not notified. 

In fact it is then a burden in which the Jira Agents, in this case the maintenance team, must edit a ticket to add those participants, ultimately they can't even add them they must "request" they be added to the ticket.

!image-2020-05-19-12-50-15-127.png!
fields.summary: Jira Ticket Submission Pages need Dynamic field to tag participants.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some users may lose the ability to *reorder filters by starred items* when checking the *saved filters page*. 

h4. Why is a user affected?
* Possibly, your username was changed at some point in the past. This is not possible since [Jira usernames deprecation due to GDPR|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud].
* It is still possible to change usernames when using *Jira Server*, so instances that migrated from Jira Server can also have some affected users in the case its name was changed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*In case your user is affected*

# Enable [Jira new navigation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/new-jira-cloud-navigation/#Frequently-asked-questions]
# Click on "Filters" (top bar) > "View All Filters"
# Click on the star to reorder filters by starred items

h3. Expected Results
The filter order is respected.


h3. Actual Results
The filter order is not respected, as seen on the image below:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Switch to the old navigation, it doesn't reproduce the problem.

h3. Notes
Atlassian support is able to confirm if you're affected by this problem or facing something else.
fields.summary: Reordering filters by "starred" may not work for some users in the new navigation

fields.description: It would be awesome to have the ability to control who can view a custom field like the issue security level but for fields.
fields.summary: Restrict access to a field

fields.description:
Today, when configuring boards with swimlanes in Jira Mac App, the title of the swimlane is restricted to one column, as displayed in the screenshot below:
 !Z- Attachment.png|thumbnail! 

Would be great if the app used all the screen width to display the swimlane title, as the web application:
 !Z- attachment 2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Expand Swimlane title in Jira Mac App

fields.description: Currently, the Regular Expression Check validator on Jira does not support the components field and that makes impossible to set a validator based on the components field value.
fields.summary: Include the field Components in the options of the Regular Expression Check validator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users can use the @mention feature for a team on *New Issue view* but it does not work for *Old Issue View* 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View an issue in *New issue view* and use the @mention feature 
 # In the comments, Attempt to search for a team you know
 # Once you've found a team, switch to *Old Issue View*
 # Repeat the same step 1 and 2

h3. Expected Results

Be able to mention  teams
h3. Actual Results

Unable to find any teams 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the @mention for teams only work in New issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Although the statuses in Next-Gen has the same name of Classic projects or other next-gen projects, the Transition Action in Jira automation will not work when you choose one of the statuses. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Multi-Project rule with a classic and next-gen project 
 # Add the transition Action, multiple To Do, In Progress, etc statuses are shown 
 # No matter what you selected it will only work for one project.
 
h3. Expected Results
It should work for all projects no matter the status ID, instead, Jira should take the status name. 
To display the status ID does not help because only one is valid and you have multiple projects in the rule. 

h3. Actual Results
Multiple statuses are shown with the same name, and it works only for one project.
 !image-2020-05-18-10-59-34-889.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Create single project rules and set the status
fields.summary: Transition Action fails for multi project rules

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Very similar to the suggestion [JRACLOUD-73694|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73694], since the "Profile Visibility" feature was released, users with Atlassian Account only able to update at id.atlassian.com.
It is not possible for the Administrator to bulk update the user profile neither define a default value instead of anyone.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to bulk update user profile or set default values.

h3. Why this is important
This is important when there are lots of users inside a company, it's difficult for admin to guide the user to update it from id.atlassian.com. It's best if this can be done by the administrator.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to set a default the profile visibility to the organization

fields.description:
Related to JRACLOUD-72429 and CONFCLOUD-67922

Even if those issues are fixed, a user could still connect their corporate google account to Jira/Atlassian, which requests permissions to view all of their Google Drive files, this would give Jira access to sensitive corporate data.

Please allow admin to turn off the ability of users to link their google accounts/other accounts to Jira.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Ability for admin to disable users ability to connect accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user is creating a global/multiple project rules, there is no next-gen status in the "Create issue" action, even if the multiple projects are only next-gen.
More details here: https://share.getcloudapp.com/JrubYGWr

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a rule;
# select "create issue" action;

h3. Expected Results
The next-gen issuetype should appear;

h3. Actual Results
.

h3. Workaround

Create for each next-gen project a rule.
fields.summary: No next-gen issuetype while creating an issue
